content.description:
First Bolt is low, starts on a jug about 6 feet high, send for a left hand jug and from there on up enjoy the slopers and the less than favorable edges to the top!

(a chimney can be climbed on the east face after a short traverse if it beats you too badly and just want to top rope it. However you will runout 2 bolts, it is decent 5.10 climbing)

Ample ledges provide great seating for your friends to watch you struggle.

The crux is the upper head wall moving beyond the under-cling pocket in my opinion.
content.location: Follow the trail from scorpion slab towards New Year's Rock, this route is in a small and cozy corner. Currently only south facing route on this rock. There's some chalk down low but none up high. the climb looks much easier than it is.

content.description:
Easy to climb and easy to find blunt Arete which has fun and excellent rock to get you thinking of days gone by. A steep step from the ground to an easier section passing three bolts on the prow leads to additional bolt protected steps and a two bolt anchor.

Rappel to descend.
content.location: Blunt arete of this cliff face, use area directions.
